intro: Antitoxicum lanceolatum, commonly known as the spearleaf antitoxic, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported detoxifying properties. However, it is important to note that the plant contains toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
